name: Calceare
desc: Calceare was a project mainly focused on the usage of Symfony, a PHP framework. As part of a group of 5 people, my job was to organize the backend aspects of the application, namely the routing aspects as well as the interfacing between the web client and the server.

name: The_Game_Library
desc: The Game Library is an IMDB-like app that runs on your phone by downloading a .apk. Using multiple APIs to reach for data, this apps lets you see the current landscape of video gaming. The key features are: a searching loop of games, developers, editors, and themes ; the possibility of saving your favourite games ; a weekly ranking of the best-rated games ; the ability to rate games and discovery the community rankings.

name: ArchiTech
desc: Life is art, and art is life. Let's discover together Jean-Pierre Ugarte, a french painter know for his brutalist architectural art pieces. Why chose this subject for a website you might ask? Well, as far as I'm concerned: both in technology and Jean-Pierre Ugarte's works, structure is everything. Is this why I like his art so much? Who know :)

name: MeMO
desc: MeMO, a website made for a student association in Montb√©liard, France. This website was created using Vue.JS and a headless CMS. My role was to be the project manager as well as a developer in a team made up of several students.

name: AterinGames
desc: AlterinGames was an app made entirely in PHP. The aim of this app was to create a community around the topic of board games. Being the leader of a group of 3 people, my role was to organize the tasks (while working in a AGILE environment), manage the code reviews, and that into account the economic aspects of the project.

name: AI-a_not_so_bright_future
desc: AI is a fascinating subject which was always very alluring to me. When tasked with making my first website as part of my junior year as a multimedia university student, this is the subject I choose. While not very impressive technically, the content of this website still remains to this day a glass window through which you might catch a glimpse of the future that could await us all.

name: Lego_Three.js
desc: While studying under Benoit Piranda, multiple projects were given to us around the thematic of web 3D. One of them was to make a small lego game using Three.js and models we made ourselves inside 3DSMAX. While I'm by no means a 3D artist, this project was still interesting for me and made my discover an aspect of the web which I didn't know a lot about.

name: e-VATplus
desc: While being part of Solead Agency as a web developer, I had the chance of witnessing many different typologies of web apps. From the simple SPA, to more complex content management systems, or even full e-commerce websites, my stay at Solead Agency drastically improved both my capabilities as a web developer, and my knowledge as a web user. E-VATplus was one of the first websites I made from A to Z while working at Solead Agency.

name: Annabel_Roussel_Hypnose
desc: As part of a more broader decision of establishing myself as a freelance web developer, I had the change to work for different clients by myself. One of the first websites I made as a freelance is Annabel Roussel Hypnose.
